Key Arguments: No individual or entity possesses perfect knowledge to determine what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
Government and experts are prone to bias and self-interest, making them unreliable arbiters of truth.
Historical examples, such as the acceptance of lobotomy, demonstrate that expert consensus can be flawed.
The proposed legislation could lead to censorship of speech that may be true.
More speech and open debate are better solutions to misinformation than regulation and censorship.
Notable Quotes: No one has the perfect knowledge required to determine what speech is misinformation/disinformation.
The best disinfectant for false information is more exposure, not less.
